name: Red Roof Inn San Antonio Downtown - Riverwalk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: booked and had confirmation for a King room,check in at 7:30pm on 6/10/13.front desk said room not clean and housekeeping gone for the day.Put us in another room with a promise to give us King room next day.Reminded front desk twice and they said don't worry when coming back we will get the king room.Come back at 9:30pm Tue,there is a new person(Roger) at front desk said he did not know nothing and he just came from vacation,request to speak to a Manager was denied and threaten to call cops .Had to Cancel my reservation and move to a different hotel late night and pay higher rate.Red Roof Inn got me good and spoiled the entire vacation. They had my sold my Room to someone else for a higher rate.Be aware they will get you and you can't move because it is in downtown area.
reviews.title: paid for room ,did not get room.

reviews.text: I was skeptical when my husband found this place online when we usually stay at nicer, more expensive hotels. Really though, you can't beat it for the money.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Great Location at Bargain Price

reviews.text: Price
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean rooms for the most part
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Visit

reviews.text: We were in for Lackland AFB graduation (4 night stay). All hotel staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable and reasonably clean. I say reasonably because laminate floor was gritty and kind of nasty. Walking on floor in socks left visible dirt / hair on feet...ewe!...... I would have expected a deeper cleaning of the room between customers. Faucet in sink was ajar. I told maintenance but no response while we were there. I'm surprised housekeeping has not reported issue as it was difficult to turn water on / off. Breakfast offerings were very basic, prepackaged pastries and bagels, fruit. On a 4 day stay, I would have liked to see a little variation and real milk or cream instead of powdered for coffee. 5th floor vending machine ripped us off for drinks a couple of times. Location was great. All in all, I would stay here again.... I appreciate the fact that the manager is commenting personally on most of the feedback posts. While some of my comments (and others) may seem 'nit picky' to some, the take away here is attention to detail. Attention to detail is the difference between a so-so average hotel (or business) and a great one!
reviews.title: Good location, adequate
Not what we expected
reviews.text: Our second stay here in about 4 years. We like the price and simplicity. The location requires a 3 block walk to the Alamo, river center mall or Riverwalk (hence the price). The rooms have been updated and all staff we encountered (especially Maribel) were helpful and friendly. Our room's wood laminate floors were pet friendly as advertised but not so nice for two kids under 3 walking around. We requested that it be cleaned and they did sweep the hair that was everywhere but we couldn't tell any mopping took place. Maribel comped our parking fees for the trouble. Probably won't stay here again.

the staff where all so friendly ,helpful , and so polite ,plus the rooms where cleaned daily ,I would definitely stay there again if I ever get the chance to return,my elder brother & myself enjoyed the hotel & friendliness of the stff ,fantastic.
reviews.title: clean & healthy & friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to San Antonio on a weekday and stayed Mon. thru Friday. The hotel had a lot of business people going to conventions during the week and was very busy. My room was newly remodeled and very clean. It did have a musty odor from the A/C that you noticed every time you left and then came back. The room was very comfaortable. The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. The continental breakfast was like a free for all in the mornings with all the business people getting breakfast. One morning the trash cans in the breakfast area was overflowing. The trash can in the parking garage needed dumping for 2 days. Overall the stay was a good one.
reviews.title: Riverwalk Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am surprised at how picky people are! Get out and enjoy life and don't nitpick!
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel far exceeded my expectations. The price is far less than I'd ever expect to pay for a hotel of this quality so close to the heart of downtown San Antonio. The customer service is straight-forward, and excellent. The rooms are nicely furnished, recently remodeled, clean, and very comfortable. The free breakfast is well-stocked, simple, and very adequate.
reviews.title: Awesome all around

reviews.text: It was the little things here and there that impressed me, and that make me want to return. The room was very, very cold. The shower didn't take too long to heat up. The bed was firm, but soft. The channel line up included two different HBO channels. The remote wasn't finicky (most places we stay, the remote has to be pointed directly at the TV to work). The room had a small fridge and microwave.
reviews.title: Unmatched Customer Service

reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that one of the two elevators in the front was broken, but that was just a tiny annoyance. Anyone visiting San Antonio and wishing to stay at an affordable hotel close to downtwon and the Riverwalk would be wise to stay here.
reviews.title: Wow what a pleasant surprise
Staff "Bent over Backward" to Make Our Stay Pleasant!
reviews.text: Newly remodeled rooms were clean and spacious, but the reason for the excellent rating was the customer service. Jessie, Mark, Willie and Zach were especially helpful for everything from extra towels to suggesting the best places to eat. However, service was brought to a new level on our check out day when our charter bus showed up six hours late. Darlene the manager brought out water and snacks, opened up the conference meeting room for us to store luggage and watch movies, and even found six open rooms when it looked like we may not be leaving. When I get back to San Antonio, you can be sure I will be booking a room at the Red Roof Inn--Downtown.

I can not say enough good things about the Red Roof in Downtown San Antonio. I just spent the last seven days there. All of the staff was so easy to work with. They went above and beyond to make us feel llike family. They even were willing to sing a happy birthday wake up call. Thank you Jessie, Mark, and Zack! The rooms were very clean ( thank you Stephanie) and tidy. At the end our trip we had an unexpected delay with our charter bus and was stuck at the hotel for 6 hours. Darlene and the rest of her staff were amazing at providing accomdations for us in this difficult situation including providing a case of water for our group. I would definitely bring my family back.
reviews.title: Worth the price & great location!

reviews.text: When I go to San Antonio, I generally stay in Boerne, TX, but this time I was going to spend most of my time downtown and in San Marcos, TX. San Marcos hotels were cheaper than this Red Roof Inn, but factor in drive time, gas, and paying to park downtown, I figure I came out a little bit ahead by staying in San Antonio at the Red Roof Inn.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: The staff was very nice throughout our stay. Our first room had a soaked towel trying to absorb water from the air conditioner, and water was streaming along the floor, so we were switched to another room. I have to concur with a previous reviewer that the air conditioning was not that good. I turned the thermostat down, but that didn't seem to make a difference. It wasn't hot, but it wasn't really cool per se. (I am usually cold in hotel rooms, but not here.) There was no refrigerator in the room, nor was there a microwave. There is a communal microwave where breakfast is served.
reviews.title: Nice
"New Rooms" is a relative term
reviews.text: The location is good. I think the description is "three blocks to the Alamo" or something like that. Well, it's true--but that is the back corner of the wall surrounding the Alamo property. You have another block or so to get to the front entrance. Not a big deal, except in 100 degree heat, it is a little disheartening.

Other than the A/C, the sink was the only other thing that had problems. The whole faucet spun around and around every time you turned on the water. Had trouble keeping the stopper open in the sink. Not a big enough deal to make a fuss about. Nice TV. Breakfast is packaged sweet rolls and coffee. I'd stay again. We were pleased overall with the price and convenience--especially not having to pay by the hour to park.
reviews.title: Really good option

reviews.text: Nice and welcoming friendly staff. Clean. Close to the Zoo and Witti. Nice close walk to downtown. Safe. Nice parking. Will come back. Good prices. Pool. Free WiFi. By a bus stop. Close to RiverCenter.
reviews.title: Great location and great price!

aka: Red Roof Inn San Antonio Downtown - Riverwalk Hotel San Antonio
description: Experience rich culture, history and southern hospitality in San Antonio, the Heart of Texas, at your Red Roof Inn Downtown-Riverwalk. When you check into the Red Roof Inn San Antonio Downtown - Riverwalk, check out the fantastic new amenities in our NextGen ® design rooms! The rooms at this 100% Smoke Free inn feature a stylish, boutique design with all new furniture, spa-inspired bathrooms with modern vessel sinks, new comfy Rest Suite beds by Serta, plush high-end bedding, modern design flooring, comfortable new seating and a large, flat-screen TV. Start your day with a complimentary Grab-and-Go select breakfast of Apples, Bagels, Muffins, Juice and Coffee. With complimentary Wi-Fi in all the guestrooms and lobby as well as a boarding pass station, you will never miss a connection. Ample parking is available for our guests onsite in our general parking lot and multi-level parking garage, at only $7 per night. The Red Roof Inn San Antonio Downtown-Riverwalk is within a pleasant walking distance of many of the attractions for which San Antonio is famous. Take a tour of the Alamo in downtown San Antonio, a short 3 blocks away or enjoy the famous Riverwalk on a relaxing riverboat cruise. Sports fanatic? The Alamodome and AT&T center host everything from football to basketball games. Enjoy shopping at the historic Market Square or experience a panoramic view of downtown San Antonio from the Tower of the Americas, both within walking distance from the Red Roof San Antonio Downtown-Riverwalk. For those visiting San Antonio on business, the San Antonio Convention Center is only 5 blocks away. With all there is to see and do in our beautiful city, your hotel should provide the amenities you want at the price you need. Fortunately, Red Roof Inn San Antonio Downtown - Riverwalk provides that and more. We're your best choice for economy lodging and superior service in the Alamo City
